content:
I've edited the "Close Mountains" validator from below:
"_/==\_/\/--\/\____"
to
"_/--\_/\/--\/\____"

Since "=" was never mentioned to be equivalent to "-" and only appears in a validator. I saw 1 year ago the creator was asked to edit it and never has. I just got 85% on a clash because of this bug.

Also, I made a small edit where the statement said:
"Input always starts and ends with plains (-)"
and corrected it to:
"Input always starts and ends with plains (_)"

I'm sorry but the statement makes no sense.
How is the player supposed to guess that "||" is a "mountain"?
Except for reverse, the player should not have to inspect the output to understand what you mean by "mountain".
When I see "mountain" I expect things like /\ or /--\ but not "||'.
What's more the statement is plainly wrong, you claim "_/-\|" are the only valid characters and yet out of the blue the "=" characters appears in a validator, making it impossible for the player to get 100% without prior knowledge.
Shame on the moderators for accepting a problem that is clearly not ready.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and fun.

Good problem, be careful with "=" symbols in "Close Mountains Validator" : you have not mentionned it in your input : "Single line containing terrain, may include characters: _/-\|". Also, your character for plains in "Input always starts and ends with plains (-)" is wrong I think (it's "_"). Correct this and your problem will be perfect !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear description, easy and fast clash. Should be mentioned that "|" can start or end a mountain, maybe specify it within the input description or one sample immediately visible.

I agree with XorZy : you may remove the "=" special char from the validators since it's not in any test case !
-> Your clash may be corrected, please, or rejected ....

Please @Micos ; change your Validator or add a Testcase !
I've edited it for him, seems he doesn't use the site. Such an annoying bug. I got 85% on a clash because of that.
